intro: Trapa litwinowii, commonly known as the Litwinowii water chestnut, is a rare aquatic plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its floating leaves and distinctive, spiny fruits that contain edible seeds. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in clusters. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Trapa litwinowii is considered endangered in many regions.
